name: Abell Cauthon
info: [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s father. His house was burned when the Trollocs attacked Emond's Field on Winternight. He has five children.

name: Ackley Farren
info: Man who once got drunk and spent the night on the roof of the inn in Market Sheran.

name: Adan al'Caar
info: Boy from Emond's Field that [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) fooled with a story about ghost dogs, shortly before releasing [Master Luhhan](#Haral-Luhhan)'s dogs covered with flour.

name: Adora Aybara
info: Adora Aybara; Perrin's sister. Her father and mother are Con Aybara and Joslyn Aybara. She has a brother, Paet, and a sister, Deselle.

name: Aemon al Caar al Thorin
info: King of Manetheren during the last part of the Trolloc Wars, until the fall of his country. He was so fearless that the best compliment that could be delivered to anyone was to say that he had Aemon's heart. He was a Warder to his Queen, [Eldrene](#Eldrene-ay-Ellan-ay-Carlan).

name: Agelmar Jagad
info: Lord of Fal Dara in Shienar. His head is shaved in the traditional Shienaran style, bare except for a topknot, and that completely white. He has brown eyes, and his face is as stony as [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran)'s.

name: Aginor
info: One of the Forsaken, the thirteen Aes Sedai who dedicated their lives to serving the Shadow during the War of the Shadow. His name is still used to frighten children.

name: Aldieb
info: [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred)'s white mare. Her name means “West Wind” in the Old Tongue.

name: Alene al'Vere
info: Alene al'Vere is the second oldest of five daughters of [Marin](#Marin-al-Vere) and [Bran al'Vere](#Brandelwyn-Bran-al-Vere) of Emond's Field.

name: Almen Bunt
info: Man from the same village as [Holdwin](#Raimun-Holdwin). He pretended to be fixing his cart while Holdwin was talking to a Fade, and later found he was looking for [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). He later offered the two a ride, since he does not like Holdwin that much and would rather help the boys than the Darkfriend.

name: Alpert Mull
info: Stolid man with a square face and square, worn hands. His cows have gone dry, his chickens have stopped laying eggs, and his pastures have gone barren. He wonders whether his land will even grow hay this year, much less a decent crop. He gave [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) a ride for a segment of their trip between Four Kings and Caemlyn. He gave them each scarves to keep the sun and dust off of them; they used to belong to his sons.

name: Alsbet Luhhan
info: Wife of [Haral](#Haral-Luhhan), the blacksmith of Emond's Field. She is almost as strong as he is, and more ill-tempered.

name: Amyrlin Seat
info: Leader of the Aes Sedai, their equivalent of a king or queen. Her authority is immense—rulers of all nations will obey a summons to the Amyrlin, even if they will spend the entire journey devising a plan to kill her while there. [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) says that [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) may become the Amyrlin Seat some day if she works hard and studies hard enough.

name: Anla
info: Character from _The Thousand Tales of Anla, the Wise Counselor_, one of [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin)'s stories.

name: Ara
info: Dark-haired, slight man from Baerlon. He works at the Stag and Lion for [Master Fitch](#Master-Fitch).

name: Arad
info: Man from old Manetheren. According to [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred), his line is strong in the Two Rivers.

name: Aram
info: Grandson of [Raen](#Raen) and [Ila](#Ila). He is of an age with [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara).

name: Arent
info: Elder of Stedding Shangtai, Ogier, and father of [Loial](#Loial). He insisted that Loial learn Treesinging.

name: Arin
info: Assistant to the watchman at the Caemlyn Gate in Baerlon.

name: Artur Hawkwing
info: Artur Hawkwing, the name by which [Artur Paendrag Tanreall](#Artur-Hawkwing) was known during his conquest of the world.

name: Artur Paendrag Tanreall
info: Hero of Legend who ruled all the lands from the Aiel Waste to the Aryth Ocean and beyond. He even sent troops across the Aryth Ocean, as well as to the lands beyond the Aiel Waste. His death set off the War of the Hundred Years. His sign was a golden hawk in flight; he was also known as [Artur Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing).

name: Avendesora
info: The Tree of Life of Legend. It leaves no seed, and is guarded by the [Green Man](#Green-Man), at least according to Legend.

name: Avendoraldera
info: Sapling cut from _[Avendesora](#Avendesora)_, the Legendary Tree of Life. The tree was a gift from the Aiel to the people of Cairhien over a century ago. The tree was cut down by [Laman Damodred](#Laman-Damodred), the King of Cairhien, twenty years ago. Laman's Sin, as this act is called, ended a century of peace with the Aiel and began the Aiel War.

name: Ba'alzamon
info: Ancient name from the Trolloc Tongue, believed to be the Trolloc name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One). It means “Heart of the Dark,” in the Old Tongue. Ba'alzamon claims to have sent the Trollocs during the Trolloc Wars for over three hundred years, told [Artur Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing) to send armies across the Aryth Ocean, and told the same Hawkwing to refuse the Aes Sedai Healing that could have saved his life and proclaim with his last breath that Tar Valon must fall.

name: Bain
info: Old man [Mull](#Alpert-Mull) knows. He let Mull have half a wagon for his own.

name: Balthamel
info: One of the Forsaken, the thirteen Aes Sedai who dedicated their lives to the Shadow during the War of the Shadow. His name is still used to frighten children.

name: Balwen Ironhand
info: Nickname given to [King Balwen of Aridhol](#King-Balwen-Mayel).

name: Bandry (Ban) Crawe
info: Bandry (Ban) Crawe is a young man from Emond's Field and the son of [Samel](#Samel-Crawe). He is about ten months older than [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Bartim
info: Innkeeper of the Wayfarer's Rest, an inn where [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin), [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), and [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) stop in Whitebridge. He complains of bad feet.

name: Basel Gill
info: Fat, pink-faced innkeeper of The Queen's Blessing, an inn in Caemlyn. His graying hair is combed back over a bald spot it didn't quite cover.

name: Bayle Domon
info: Stocky captain of the _Spray_, the boat [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), and [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) leap on to in order to get from Aridhol to Whitebridge, and away from the Trollocs. He has long hair to his thick shoulders, a round face, and a beard that does not touch his mustache.

name: Bela
info: [Tam](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor)'s work horse, a shaggy brown mare.

name: Berin Thane
info: [Jon Thane](#Jon-Thane)'s brother. His house was burned by Trollocs on Winternight. His house is across the street from [Abell Cauthon](#Abell-Cauthon)'s house.

name: Berin
info: Man whose retreat is the subject of a song the Tinkers sing, “Berin's Retreat.” It is known in Emond's Field as “The Wind From the North.”

name: Berowyn al'Vere
info: Berowyn al'Vere, is the oldest of the five daughters of [Bran](#Brandelwyn-Bran-al-Vere) and [Marin al'Vere](#Marin-al-Vere). She is [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s oldest sister, and has been allowed to wear her hair in a braid, the Two Rivers symbol of adulthood for women, since she was sixteen years old.

name: Betrayer of Hope
info: A nickname given to [Ishamael](#Ishamael)

name: Bili Congar
info: Bili Congar is a man from Emond's Field. According to [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), he is always doing stupid things and always getting hurt. She has very little, if any, respect for him. He is of an age with [Haral Luhhan](#Haral-Luhhan), but he _looks_ as though he is about ten years older due to his hollow cheeks and sunken eyes.

name: Bili al'Dai
info: Bili al'Dai is a young man from Emond's Field. He is [Master al'Dai](#Master-al-Dai)'s grandson.

name: Blaes of Matuchin
info: Golden-haired hero of Legend. She is in one of [Thom Merrilin](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin)'s stories, “The Bargain of [Rogosh Eagle Eye](#Rogosh-of-Talmour).”

name: Bodewhin (Bode) Cauthon
info: Bodewhin (Bode) Cauthon is a girl from Emond's Field. She is about one year younger than [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere). She seems to enjoy telling on her brother, [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), after he has gotten himself into mischief (which is quite often).

name: Brandelwyn (Bran) al'Vere
info: Brandelwyn (Bran) al'Vere is the mayor of Emond's Field and innkeeper of the Winespring Inn. He is the father of five girls, including [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere). He has a large girth, about double of anyone else, and a fringe of thinning gray hair. He is known around town as being very stubborn, and not someone to be trifled with.

name: Breyan Mandragoran
chapter: Chapter 47: More Tales of the Wheel
info: [Lain](#Lain-Mandragoran)'s wife. She was furious that her husband was not chosen as king of Malkier over her brother-in-law [Akir](#al-Akir-Mandragoran); she dared her husband to march his men to Shayol Ghul itself. When they were defeated, she attempted to frame Akir, saying that if he had brought the rest of the men of Malkier, Shayol Ghul would have fallen. She then plotted with [Cowin Fairheart](#Cowin-Gemallen) to attempt to seize the throne of Malkier for her son, [Isam](#Isam-Mandragoran). Breyan fled Malkier when it fell to the Shadow, disappeared with Isam into the Blight, and was never seen again.

name: Buad of Albhain
info: Character from “The Last Ride of Buad of Albhain,” one of [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin)'s stories.

name: Burn
chapter: Chapter 21: Listen to the WindChapter 22: A Path ChosenChapter 23: Wolfbrother
info: Wolf that [Elyas](#Elyas-Machera) knows. He is a grizzled fighter.

name: Caar One-Hand
info: Nickname given to [Caar al Thorin al Toren](#Caar-al-Thorin-al-Toren), heir to the throne of Manetheren.

name: Caar al Thorin al Toren
info: [Aemon](#Aemon-al-Caar-al-Thorin)'s father, [Thorin](#Thorin-al-Toren-al-Ban)'s son.

name: Calle Coplin
info: Calle Coplinis a young woman from Emond's Field. She has not been granted the privilege of wearing her hair in a braid, the symbol of womanhood in Emond's Field, even though she is well into her twenties. She enjoys flirting, and does not seem to be bothered by the fact that many girls as many as four years her junior are considered grown women while she is not.

name: Cenn Buie
info: Cenn Buie, the thatcher in Emond's Field. He is gnarled but spry, and speaks with a raspy voice. He sits on the Village Council, but is probably the most disagreeable member on it.

name: Ciel
info: Waitress and kitchen assistant in the Stag and Lion in Baerlon.

name: Cilia Cole
info: Cilia Cole is a from Emond's Field. [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) considers her a “ninny”. She likes to stare and make calf-eyes at [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara); Egwene thinks Perrin at least ought to _notice_ her attentions.

name: Cinda
info: Servant in the kitchen of the Stag and Lion in Baerlon.

name: Cirri
info: Cat in the Stag and Lion in Baerlon. She belongs to [Sara](#Sara), the cook.

name: Cloud
info: Tall gray horse with a black mane and tail. [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran) purchased him from [Jon Thane](#Jon-Thane), who used him for racing. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) rode him out of Emond's Field.

name: Con Aybara
info: Con Aybara, father of [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara), [Adora](#Adora-Aybara), [Deselle](#Deselle-Aybara), and [Paetram](#Paetram-Aybara) and husband of [Joslyn](#Joslyn-Aybara).

name: Coramoor
info: Man who, according to Sea Folk prophecy, will bring the Atha'an Miere out of the sea.

name: Corin Ayellin
info: Corin Ayellin is a slim woman from Emond's Field. She has a thick gray braid that hangs down as far as her hips. She bakes the best sweets in Emond's Field, possibly in the Two Rivers—[Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) asserts that her own mother's are better, but even her mother admits that Mistress Ayellin's are the best.

name: Cowin Fairheart
chapter: Chapter 47: More Tales of the Wheel
info: A nickname given to [Cowin Gemallen](#Cowin-Gemallen)

name: Cowin Gemallen
chapter: Chapter 47: More Tales of the Wheel
info: Man who plotted with [Breyan](#Breyan-Mandragoran) to seize the throne of Malkier for her son [Isam](#Isam-Mandragoran). He was almost made King of Malkier himself—if two people had voted the other way on the council, he would have been. Unknown to everyone until shortly before the fall of Malkier, he was a Darkfriend. When they found out, many called for his head on a pike, but as he was so close to the king, he instead was allowed to duel with the king, and was slain by [Akir](#al-Akir-Mandragoran). Also called Cowin Fairheart.

name: Creator
info: Maker of the world, the True Source, everything in existence. At the moment of Creation, the Creator sealed the [Dark One](#Dark-One) in a prison at Shayol Ghul to keep him from influencing the world.

name: Dag Coplin
info: Boy from Emond's Field that [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) fooled with a story about ghost dogs, shortly before releasing [Master Luhhan](#Haral-Luhhan)'s dogs covered with flour.

name: Dai Shan
info: Title used by those in the Borderlands for [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran), as well as others such as [Agelmar](#Agelmar-Jagad). The title is that of the Diademed Battle Lords, the generals of the Borderlands.

name: Dain Bornhald
info: Son of [Geofram](#Geofram-Bornhald). He is a little too easily influenced, in his father's opinion. He was one of the men [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) got all muddy with his barrel stunt in Baerlon.

name: Daise Congar
info: [Wit](#Wit-Congar)'s wife. She is twice as wide as he is. She has a hard face, and not an ounce of fat on her. She controls her husband much more than he controls her.

name: Dannil Lewin
info: Dannil Lewin, a boy from Emond's Field. He is even skinnier than [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), is a year older than him, and is described as having a thrusting nose.

name: Dapple
chapter: Chapter 21: Listen to the WindChapter 22: A Path ChosenChapter 23: Wolfbrother
info: Wolf that [Elyas](#Elyas-Machera) knows. Her fur fades through a dozen shades of gray. She is the alpha female, the leader of her pack.

name: Dar
info: Assistant to the watchman at the Caemlyn Gate in Baerlon.

name: Darith
info: King in one of [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin)'s stories.

name: Dark One
info: Name, used in every land, for [Shai'tan](#Dark-One).

name: Darl Coplin
info: Man from a farm near Emond's Field. He spent half the night demanding that [Bran al'Vere](#Brandelwyn-Bran-al-Vere) send [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) and [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran) away. He blamed them for bringing the Trollocs to Emond's Field.

name: Darling Sara
info: Subject of a song [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) plays in Arien. He knows it as “Ferry O'er the River,” but the innkeeper there called it “Darling Sara.”

name: Dav Ayellin
info: Dav Ayellin is a boy from Emond's Field, of an age with [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon). He and Mat are friends, and like to get into mischief together. In fact, he and Mat seem to have a competition over who can get into the most trouble.

name: Davian
info: False [Dragon](#The-Dragon) of old times. [Ba'alzamon](#Ba-alzamon) claims that he was used by Aes Sedai, just as all other false Dragons were.

name: Demandred
info: One of the Forsaken, the thirteen Aes Sedai who dedicated their lives to the Shadow during the War of the Shadow. His name is still used to frighten children.

name: Deselle Aybara
info: Deselle Aybara is [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s younger sister.

name: Doral Barran
info: Doral Barran was the Wisdom of Emond's Field. She is the oldest woman in Emond's Field, possibly in the entire Two Rivers. She is white-haired and frail, though still clear-eyed and not stooped at all. Her last apprentice died of a mysterious illness that she could not cure. She mentored [Nynaeve al'Meara](#Nynaeve-al-Meara), who recently replaced her as Wisdom.

name: Dragon Reborn
info: According to the Prophecies of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon), the man who will be Reborn at mankind's greatest hour of need to save the world. He is the Rebirth of [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon), the Dragon. It is said that he will save the world—and Break it again.

name: Easar Togita
info: King of Shienar. His capital is in Fal Moran.

name: Eazil Forney
info: Farmer from near Arien. He was at the inn there, drank too much, and had to stay overnight. The innkeeper asked him to give the entertainment, [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), a ride along the road for a ways.

name: Egwene al'Vere
info: Egwene al'Vere is a 17-year-old girl from Emond's Field. She is the daughter of [Bran](#Brandelwyn-Bran-al-Vere), the Mayor of Emond's Field, and his wife [Marin](#Marin-al-Vere). Egwene has four older sisters; [Berowyn](#Berowyn-al-Vere), [Alene](#Alene-al-Vere), [Elisa](#Elisa-al-Vere), and [Loise](#Loise-al-Vere); and resents them at times for treating her as the baby of the family.

name: Elaida do Avriny a'Roihan
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah and advisor to [Queen Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) of Andor. She sometimes has the Foretelling.

name: Elam Dowtry
info: Elam Dowtry is one of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s friends in Emond's Field.

name: Elan Morin Tedronai
info: Man who appears to [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) shortly after he killed his entire family. He Healed Lews Therin from his madness, allowing him to finally realize what he had done. Elan Morin is now known as [Ishamael](#Ishamael), which means “[Betrayer of Hope](#Betrayer-of-Hope)” in the Old Tongue. He claims to follow a “different power” now, that of the [Dark One](#Dark-One) himself. He was once humbled by Lews Therin in the Hall of Servants, and defeated by him at the gates of Paaren Disen. However, Lews Therin fled and killed himself before Elan Morin could do with him as he had planned.

name: Elayne Trakand
info: Daughter-Heir of Andor, daughter of [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) and sister of [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand). She is quite pretty. She is preparing to leave for Tar Valon to undergo novice training, as all daughters-heir of Andor have done since the nation's founding.

name: Eldrene ay Ellan ay Carlan
info: Queen of Manetheren during the Trolloc Wars, wife of [Aemon](#Aemon-al-Caar-al-Thorin), her Warder. It was said that she was so beautiful flowers bloomed to make her smile. She was also called Ellisande, “Rose of the Sun” in the Old Tongue.

name: Eldrin Cauthon
info: Eldrin Cauthon is a girl from Emond's Field. She is about two years younger than [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere). She seems to enjoy telling on her brother, [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), after he has gotten himself into mischief (which is quite often).

name: Elisa al'Vere
info: Elisa al'Vere is the third oldest of five daughters of [Marin](#Marin-al-Vere) and [Bran](#Brandelwyn-Bran-al-Vere) al'Vere of Emond's Field. She is one year older than [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara).

name: Elmindreda (Min) Farshaw
info: Young woman from Baerlon. She has short dark hair that she keeps like most boys her age do. She is slender, and barely taller than [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred). Her dark eyes are bigger than [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s. She dresses like most boys do, a habit she picked up from her hours in the mines with her father; her mother is dead. Min has a special ability, known to few; she can see images around people that predict their future. Moiraine calls them pieces of the Pattern. She sees a lot of things around [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and his friends, but she claims that if she told Rand everything she saw about him, he would be as curly-haired as his “friend with the shoulders.”

name: Else Grinwell
info: Dark-haired, big-eyed, pretty daughter of the Grinwell farmers, the eldest of nine. She is nineteen, a year younger than [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon).

name: Elyas Machera
info: Man who lives in the woods. He has graying brown hair to his waist, held at the neck by a cord. He wears a thick beard across half his chest. He can communicate with wolves, and he lives alone, except for his wolf friends, and never expected to find another who had the same ability—until he met [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara).

name: Ewal Coplin
info: Young man from the Two Rivers. He and the rest of his family used to make fun of [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) for his gray eyes, until Rand punched him in the nose.

name: Eward Candwin
info: Man from Emond's Field. He got a gash down his back when the Trollocs attacked, but was Healed by [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred).

name: Eward Congar
info: Man from Emond's Field who always walks with his nose in the air. He once fell off the Wagon Bridge and had to come home all wet. That chilled him out for about a month, according to [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon).

name: Ewin Finngar
info: Ewin Finngar is a boy from Emond's Field. He is about six years younger than [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon).

name: Farede
chapter: Chapter 50: Meetings at the EyeChapter 51: Against the ShadowChapter 52: There Is Neither Beginning Nor EndChapter 53: The Wheel TurnsGlossary
info: Panarch of Tarabon near the end of the War of the Hundred Years. She was responsible for promulgating the calendar that now bears her name, which measures years of the New Era (NE), the first of which marked the (arbitrary) end of the War.

name: Father of Lies
info: One of the many euphemisms for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Floran Gelb
info: Crewman on board [Bayle Domon](#Bayle-Domon)'s vessel. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) landed on top of him when he and his companions leaped onto the boat; Gelb was asleep on his watch.

name: Gaidal Cain
info: Hero of Legend. He appears in several of [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin)'s stories, including “Gaidal Cain's Sword.”

name: Galadedrid (Galad) Damodred
info: Handsomest man [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) has ever seen. He is tall and slender, and has dark hair and eyes. He is the son of [Tigraine](#Tigraine-Mantear) and [Taringail Damodred](#Taringail-Damodred), and the half-brother of [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand)". He always does the right thing, even if he should not.

name: Gareth Bryne
info: Captain-General of the Queen's Guards in Caemlyn.

name: Gawyn Trakand
info: Son of [Queen Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) and brother of [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand). He will become First Prince of the Sword if his sister ascends to the Throne.

name: Geofram Bornhald
chapter: Chapter 28: Footprints in AirChapter 29: Eyes Without PityChapter 30: Children of Shadow
info: Lord Captain of a band of the Children of the Light. He meets up with [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) and [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) in the abandoned _stedding_.

name: Gilda
chapter: Chapter 41: Old Friends and New Threats
info: Serving maid in the Queen's Blessing in Caemlyn. She reports that there are Whitecloaks in the Common Room to [Master Gill](#Basel-Gill).

name: Grassburner
chapter: Chapter 50: Meetings at the EyeChapter 51: Against the ShadowChapter 52: There Is Neither Beginning Nor EndChapter 53: The Wheel TurnsGlossary
info: Name, used especially by Aiel, for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Green Man
info: Character in one of [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin)'s stories. According to Legend, he guards _[Avendesora](#Avendesora)_, the Tree of Life, as well as the Eye of the World.

name: Guaire Amalasan
info: False [Dragon](#The-Dragon) of old times. [Ba'alzamon](#Ba-alzamon) claims that he was used by Aes Sedai, just as all other false Dragons were.

name: Halan
info: Elder of Stedding Shangtai, Ogier, father of [Arent](#Arent), and grandfather of [Loial](#Loial).

name: Haman
info: An Ogier, one of the Elders in _Stedding Shangtai_. [Loial](#Loial) has great respect for him.

name: Haral Luhhan
info: Haral Luhhan is the Blacksmith of Emond's Field. His arms are as big as most men's legs, and his chest strains his shirt. He is the tallest man in the Two Rivers. [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-Aybara) is his apprentice. His wife, [Alsbet](#Alsbet-Luhhan), is almost as large as he is. He sits on the Village Council.

name: Hari Coplin
info: [Darl](#Darl-Coplin)'s brother. He also blames [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) for bringing the Trollocs to Emond's Field.

name: He Who Comes With the Dawn
info: According to the Aiel Prophecy, the man who will come to unite their people and lead them out of the Waste.

name: Heartfang
info: Name the wolves use for [Ba'alzamon](#Ba-alzamon).

name: Heartsbane
chapter: Chapter 47: More Tales of the Wheel
info: Alternative name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Heran Adan
info: Governor of Baerlon. He will not cooperate with the Children of the Light who are in the city.

name: Herot
chapter: Chapter 47: More Tales of the Wheel
info: Hero of old. He has a crossing in Malkier named after him.

name: Hopper
chapter: Chapter 21: Listen to the WindChapter 22: A Path ChosenChapter 23: Wolfbrother
info: Wolf that [Elyas](#Elyas-Machera) knows. He is an older wolf, but very smart. He is dedicated to [Dapple](#Dapple); his mission in life is to see that what she wants is carried out.

name: Howal Gode
info: Merchant from Whitebridge. He wears silk-lined velvet cloaks and velvet slippers. He drives two black coaches. He is also a Darkfriend.

name: Hu Barran
info: Stablehand at the Winespring Inn in Emond's Field.

name: Hyam Kinch
info: Farmer whose cart [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) ride after leaving The Queen's Man, an inn in a town along the Caemlyn road. He is leathery-faced and taciturn.

name: Ila
info: [Raen](#Raen)'s wife. She is a head taller than her husband.

name: Ilyena Therin Moerelle
info: Wife of [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon). She has blonde hair. She was called "Sunhair." She died along with her children when her insane husband killed them, and her.

name: Ingtar Shinowa
info: Soldier from Shienar. His hair is arranged in the Shienaran warrior style, shaved except for a topknot. He is one of the officers under [Agelmar](#Agelmar-Jagad).

name: Isam Mandragoran
chapter: Chapter 47: More Tales of the Wheel
info: Infant son of [Lain](#Lain-Mandragoran) and [Breyan](#Breyan-Mandragoran). His mother's attempt to seize the throne of Malkier for him ended in the fall of Malkier itself; Isam and Breyan disappeared into the Blight and were never heard from again.

name: Ishamael
info: One of the Forsaken, the thirteen Aes Sedai who dedicated their lives to serving the Shadow during the War of the Shadow. His name means "[Betrayer of Hope](#Betrayer-of-Hope)" in the Old Tongue. He was called [Elan Morin Tedronai](#Elan-Morin-Tedronai) in the Age of Legends, before he turned to the Shadow. His name is still used to frighten children.

name: Jac al'Caar
info: Jac al'Caar is a Shepherd from near Emond's Field.

name: Jaem
info: Giant-slayer from one of [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin)'s stories. He is also featured in a song, “Jaem's Folly,” that is popular among Two Rivers folk.

name: Jaim
info: Subject of a song [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) knows. It is called “Jolly Jaim” where Rand learned it, but in Four Kings it is known as “Rhea's Fling.”

name: Jain Charin
chapter: Chapter 47: More Tales of the Wheel
info: Makieri hero who captured [Cowin Fairheart](#Cowin-Gemallen) and brought him back to the Seven Towers for justice. He was already called Farstrider at that point.

name: Jain Farstrider
info: Jain Farstrider is the main character in [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s favorite book, _The Travels of Jain Farstrider_. He has traveled all over the world, including the lands beyond the Aiel Waste and the Great Blight. He disappeared years ago and has not been heard from since.

name: Jak
info: Bouncers at The Dancing Cartman. His arms are big enough to be legs.

name: Jaret Byar
chapter: Chapter 28: Footprints in AirChapter 29: Eyes Without PityChapter 30: Children of Shadow
info: Tall Child of the Light. He has little in the way of human emotions, and thinks nothing of killing people. He hates no one; if he believes they should die, it is only because he thinks they should die, not because he hates them.

name: Jehaan
chapter: Chapter 47: More Tales of the Wheel
info: Hero of old. He has a landmark in Malkier named after him: the Stair of Jehaan, the place where the last of the Malkieri gave their lives in a futile attempt to save their nation.

name: Jillie Lewin
info: Jillie Lewin is a young woman from Emond's Field. She is a year younger than [Elisa al'Vere](#Elisa-al-Vere), and wears her hair in a black braid that extends below her waist.

name: Jon Thane
info: Miller of Emond's Field. His mill is actually out of town. He sits on the Village Council.

name: Joslyn Aybara
info: Joslyn Aybara is the mother of [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara), [Adora](#Adora-Aybara), [Deselle](#Deselle-Aybara), and [Paetram](#Paetram-Aybara) and wife of [Con](#Con-Aybara). She is very pretty, in [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s view, who thinks her smile could make the Sun bide its head in defeat.

name: Kari Thane
info: One of [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s friends. Egwene asked [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) if she can channel when Moiraine said there was another woman in her village who could do so. She does not realize that the woman Moiraine was referring to was [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara).

name: Kari al'Thor
info: [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s mother. She died about fifteen years ago, when Rand was five. His only memory of her was that she had gentle hands and a soft voice. Tam met her when he left Emond's Field; they were married, and returned later with a child.

name: Karil
info: Goodwife in one of [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin)'s stories. In this story, she cured her husband of snoring.

name: Kenley Ahan
info: Kenley Ahan is a boy from Emond's Field in the Two Rivers. He is about two years older than [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere).

name: King Balwen Mayel
info: King of Aridhol before its collapse. During his reign, a man named [Mordeth](#Mordeth) came to be his advisor. Mordeth advised using the Shadow's tactics, its evil, against it; eventually this evil consumed the city, and only Mordeth survived. He was also known as Balwen Ironhand before Mordeth's arrival.

name: Kinslayer
info: New name given to [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) after he massacred his entire family and everyone he ever loved in his madness.

name: Lain Mandragoran
chapter: Chapter 47: More Tales of the Wheel
info: [Akir](#al-Akir-Mandragoran)'s brother, [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran)'s uncle. He was married to [Breyan](#Breyan-Mandragoran). His brother and he were as close as twins, and never let even Akir's becoming king get in the way. His wife, however, was jealous of Akir, and dared her husband to march his men all the way to Shayol Ghul itself, hoping to use the inevitable defeat as cause to pull Akir off the throne. Lain died in the Blasted Lands.

name: Laman Damodred
info: King of Cairhien before and during the Aiel War, which ended about twenty years ago. He cut down _[Avendoraldera](#Avendoraldera)_, the sapling from the Tree of Life, given to the people of Cairhein hundreds of years ago by the Aiel. This Sin, as it was called, precipitated the Aiel War and led to Laman's Death.

name: Lamgwin Dorn
chapter: Chapter 37: The Long ChaseChapter 38: RescueChapter 39: Weaving of the Web
info: Man [Basel Gill](#Basel-Gill) hired to guard his door against anyone who would bring ill to his inn or its guests. He is bulky, and has heavy-lidded eyes. Despite his bulk, he moves like a cat. He thinks [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) to be the greatest queen in the World.

name: Lanfear
info: Lanfear is one of the Forsaken; the thirteen Aes Sedai who dedicated their lives to the Shadow during the War of the Shadow. Her name is still used to frighten children into behaving as they should—it is said that she waits for children who steal.

name: Lara Ayellan
info: One of [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s friends. Egwene asked [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) if she can channel when Moiraine said there was another woman in her village who could do so. She does not realize that the woman Moiraine was referring to was [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara).

name: Leafblighter
info: Aiel name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Lem Thane
info: Lem Thane is the son of [Jon Thane](#Jon-Thane), miller of Emond's Field. He is about eight months younger than [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Lenn
info: Man who flew to the moon in the belly of an eagle made of fire in one of [Thom Merrilin](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin)'s gleeman tales. The story precedes the Age of Legends.

name: Lews Therin Telamon
info: The [Dragon](#The-Dragon), [Lord of the Morning](#Lord-of-the-Morning), [Kinslayer](#Kinslayer), Breaker of the World. He is a tall man just into his middle years. He was handsome once, but now he has more white hair than brown, and his face is lined from strain and worry. He has dark eyes. Known as the Dragon during the War of the Shadow. He killed his entire family in the madness that seized him after resealing the [Dark One](#Dark-One)'s prison.

name: Lian
info: Character in one of [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin)'s stories, “Lian's stand.”

name: Lini Eltring
info: Nurse to [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) during their respective childhoods.

name: Logain Ablar
info: False [Dragon](#The-Dragon) from Ghealdan. News of his battles in Ghealdan reached Emond's Field with [Padan Fain](#Padan-Fain) on Winternight—it was probably the last place in this part of the world to hear about it. He can channel the One Power, and has been able to defend himself against the Aes Sedai that are poised to capture and gentle him.

name: Loial
info: Son of [Arent](#Arent) son of [Halan](#Halan), an Ogier from Stedding Shangtai. He came to Caemlyn, and took up residence in the library of The Queen's Blessing. He is about ninety years old, which by Ogier standards is too young to leave the _stedding_ alone, and ten years too young to address the Stump.

name: Loise al'Vere
info: Loise al'Vere is one of five daughters of [Marin](#Marin-al-Vere) and [Bran al'Vere](#Brandelwyn-Bran-al-Vere), the innkeepers of Emond's Field. She is six years older than their youngest daughter [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere).

name: Lord of the Dawn
info: Alternative use of the title [Lord of the Morning](#Lord-of-the-Morning).

name: Lord of the Grave
chapter: Chapter 41: Old Friends and New Threats
info: Alternative name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Lord of the Morning
info: Title by which [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) was known by during the Age of Legends and the War of Power.

name: Lothair Mantelar
chapter: Chapter 50: Meetings at the EyeChapter 51: Against the ShadowChapter 52: There Is Neither Beginning Nor EndChapter 53: The Wheel TurnsGlossary
info: Author of _The Way of the Light_ and founder of the Children of the Light.

name: Luc Mantear
info: Son of the Queen of Andor before [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) was queen. He disappeared into the Blight suddenly, and was never seen again.

name: Machin Shin
info: The Black Wind. It is a creature of the Ways, perhaps spawned from the taint, perhaps from something else. It wanders the Ways, consuming the souls of those it encounters. Those who make it out after being touched by _Machin Shin_ are soulless, hollow shells—if they make it out at all.

name: Mandarb
info: [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran)'s black stallion. His name means “Blade” in the Old Tongue.

name: Mara
info: Character from one of [Thom Merrilin](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin)'s stories, “Mara and the Three Foolish Kings.”

name: Mari
info: Servant in the kitchen of the Stag and Lion in Baerlon.

name: Marin al'Vere
info: [Bran](#Brandelwyn-Bran-al-Vere)'s wife, [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s mother. She is slender, and keeps her hair in a thick, gray braid.

name: Martyn Tallanvor
info: Guardsman-lieutenant in the Queen's Guards of Andor.

name: Mashadar
info: The evil that consumed Aridhol, now called Shadar Logoth, during the Trolloc Wars.

name: Master Andra
info: Name [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran) uses in some cities, including Baerlon.

name: Master Avin
info: Gatekeeper of the south gate of Baerlon. He “forgot” that he let [Alys](#Mistress-Alys), [Andra](#Master-Andra), and their companions through the gate.

name: Master Aydaer
chapter: Chapter 28: Footprints in AirChapter 29: Eyes Without PityChapter 30: Children of Shadow
info: Cabinetmaker of Emond's Field. He knows the value of good craftsmanship.

name: Master Cole
info: Master Cole is an old man from Emond's Field. He is as old as the [Wisdom](#Doral-Barran), perhaps even older. Despite this, he still has a full head of hair, though it's white now.

name: Master Fitch
info: Innkeeper of the Stag and Lion, an inn in Baerlon. He has wispy hair that sticks out everywhere.

name: Master Grinwell
info: Sturdy farmer with nine children. His farm is on the Caemlyn road. His eldest daughter, [Else](#Else-Grinwell), is a year younger than [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Master Hightower
chapter: Chapter 11: The Road to Taren Ferry
info: Man who operates the ferry at Taren Ferry.

name: Master Inlow
info: Innkeeper at The Queen's Man, the inn where [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) takes ill. He was willing to treat Rand and [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) quite nicely, as long as Mat kept Rand out of the common room.

name: Master al'Dai
info: Master al'Dai is a lean old man from Emond's Field with wispy white hair. As old or older than [Master Cole](#Master-Cole), he is unable to walk without the assistance of a cane. He is [Bili al'Dai](#Bili-al-Dai)'s grandfather. Despite his advanced years, his eyes remain clear and sharp, as does his mind. He is also quite quick with the shears, almost as fast as [Tam al'Thor](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor) and faster than everyone else.

name: Materese
info: The Healer, Mother of the Wondrous Ind in one of [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin)'s stories. Her story predates the Age of Legends.

name: Matrim (Mat) Cauthon
info: Matrim (Mat) Cauthon, a boy from Emond's Field. He has brown eyes. Mat is known for his practical jokes and other mischief, often getting his best friends in trouble with him. He is good friends with [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-Aybara), though he seems to have a contest going with [Dav Ayellin](#Dav-Ayellin) as to who can get the other into the most trouble. He has two younger sisters, [Bodewhin](#Bodewhin-Bode-Cauthon) and [Eldrin](#Eldrin-Cauthon). As a twenty year-old, Mat has grown to be one of the tallest men in the Two Rivers. He is still known for his practical jokes and other mischief; whenever something goes wrong in Emond's Field, Mat is the one everyone looks to first.

name: Mavra Mallen
info: Wisdom of Deven Ride. She came to Emond's Field to take care of things during [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) absence.

name: Mistress Alys
info: Name [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) uses in some cities, including Baerlon.

name: Mistress Aynora
info: Woman with a rooster in a song Rand played at the [Grinwell](#Else-Grinwell)'s house.

name: Mistress Calder
info: Owner of one of the houses that survived Winternight in Emond's Field.

name: Mistress Grinwell
info: Yellow-haired mistress of the Grinwell farm.

name: Mistress al'Donel
info: Woman from Emond's Field. She demanded that [Bran al'Vere](#Brandelwyn-Bran-al-Vere) fix the problem that no storks were nesting on the rooftops this spring. He honestly does not know what she would have him do.

name: Moiraine Damodred
info: Guest in Emond's Field the day before Bel Tine. She has large dark eyes and keeps her dark hair in ringlets. She barely comes to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s chest.

name: Mordeth
info: Sleek, overfed man with drooping eyelids. He is short and completely bald. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), and [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) encountered him in Aridhol when they went off to see the city. In reality, Mordeth was the advisor to [Balwen](#King-Balwen-Mayel), the last king of Aridhol. He ordered the death of [Caar](#Caar-al-Thorin-al-Toren), heir to the throne of Manetheren, when he came to Aridhol in an attempt to bring it back to the Second Covenant. His spirit has been trapped inside the walls of Aridhol ever since, and it is said that if he ever accompanies anyone to the city walls, he will be able to consume that person's soul and escape.

name: Mosk
info: Giant who fought with a Lance of Fire that could reach around the world in one of [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin)'s stories. He fought with several people, including [Queen Alsbet](#Queen-Alsbet), ruler off the world. The story of Mosk predates the Age of Legends.

name: Mother Brune
info: Wisdom-equivalent in The Queen's Man, the inn where [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) takes ill.

name: Mother Grubb
chapter: Chapter 37: The Long ChaseChapter 38: RescueChapter 39: Weaving of the Web
info: Woman in Caemlyn who sells herbs and poultices, births babies, tends the sick and tells fortunes. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) considered asking for her services to help [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon).

name: Mutch
info: Worker at the Stag and Lion in Baerlon.

name: Narg
info: Trolloc among those who attacked [Tam](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor) and [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) on their farm. He stayed back and played dead when the other Trollocs left the farm—“Narg stay. Narg smart.” He speaks English, albeit poorly, and talked to Rand for a short time before Rand killed him with Tam's sword.

name: Natti Cauthon
info: Natti Cauthon is a woman from Emond's Field and the mother of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon). She is always calm and collected, which [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) figures is necessary for someone with a son like Mat. She always seems to know about Mat's escapades; Mat is not sure how she always knows, but it is obvious to Egwene that his two younger sisters enjoy the role of tattletale.

name: Nynaeve al'Meara
info: Nynaeve al'Meara is a 24-year-old woman from Emond's Field. She has brown hair and eyes, and is quite slender. She studied under [Doral Barran](#Doral-Barran), the Wisdom of Emond's Field. After Mistress Barran's death, Nynaeve herself became the Wisdom. Her adult height is about as tall as [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s shoulder. Many people _still_ think Nynaeve is too young to be the Wisdom; however, mentioning this to her is a good way to get whacked by the stick she carries.

name: Oren Dautry
info: Nearest neighbor to the al'Thor farm. He is a shameless borrower. [Tam](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor) thinks he may have some livestock he is willing to part with.

name: Owyn Merrilin
info: [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin)'s nephew, his brother's only son. Thom left his position as Court-bard in the Royal Court of Andor, where he was known from Tear to Maradon as one of the best bards, to help Owyn with some trouble he had with Aes Sedai.

name: Padan Fain
info: Pale skinny peddler with gangly arms and a huge beak of a nose that comes to Emond's Field about once a year. He always smiles and laughs as if he knows some joke no one else knows. He came just before Bel Tine to trade, and brought news of the war in Ghealdan against the false [Dragon](#The-Dragon).

name: Paet al'Caar
info: Paet al'Caar is a shepherd from near Emond's Field and the father of [Wil](#Wil-al-Caar).

name: Paetram Aybara
info: Paetram Aybara is [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s baby brother.

name: Paitr Conel
info: Darkfriend that [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) encounter in Market Sheran.

name: Perrin Aybara
info: Perrin Aybara is a boy of about 19 years of age from Emond's field. He is one of the tallest boys in Emond's Field, even taller than [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), one of his two best friends (though since Rand is not yet finished growing, it is possible he will catch Perrin eventually). He is also good friends with [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), who often gets Perrin and Rand into trouble. He has curly hair, and is very stocky and generally big. He is very shy and laughs seldomly. His parents arranged to have him apprenticed to [Haral Luhhan](#Haral-Luhhan), the blacksmith of Emond's Field. Perrin has two younger sisters, [Adora](#Adora-Aybara) and [Deselle](#Deselle-Aybara), and one younger brother, [Paetram](#Paetram-Aybara).

name: Prince of the Morning
info: Title referring to the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), in reference to the Rebirth of the [Lord of the Morning](#Lord-of-the-Morning), [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon).

name: Promised One
info: Name used in prophecies to refer to the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), the man foretold to come at mankind's greatest hour of need to save the world.

name: Queen Alsbet
info: Queen of All in several of [Thom Merrilin](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin)'s stories. Her story predates the Age of Legends.

name: Queen Morgase Trakand
info: By the Grace of the Light, Queen of Andor, Protector of the Realm, Defender of the People, High Seat of House Trakand. She is [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand)'s mother.

name: Raen
info: Madhi (“Seeker”) of a group of Tinkers. He has gray hair, and is married to [Ila](#Ila). He is [Aram](#Aram)'s grandfather. [Elyas](#Elyas-Machera), [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara), and [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) stay with them for a while.

name: Ragan
info: Soldier from Shienar. He asked [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran), eagerly, if the Golden Crane would fly again.

name: Raimun Holdwin
info: Man from a village near Caemlyn. He is a Darkfriend, and talked to a Myrddraal outside his inn.

name: Ramey
chapter: Chapter 44: The Dark Along the Ways
info: Stablehand at The Queen's Blessing in Caemlyn.

name: Rand al'Thor
info: Rand al'Thor is a shepherd from the Two Rivers. He is the tallest boy in Emond's Field. He has grey eyes and reddish hair, both of which are unheard of in the Two Rivers. His mother died when Rand was five; [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) thinks he envies boys that have mothers. Rand is good friends with [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-Aybara). As a twenty year-old, Rand is about a head taller than Perrin, and taller than Mat as well. Rand and the Mayor's daughter, Egwene, have been all but Promised to each other since they were both young; this is often the subject of ridicule by Mat and Perrin.

name: Raolin Darksbane
info: False [Dragon](#The-Dragon) of old times. [Ba'alzamon](#Ba-alzamon) claims that he was used by Aes Sedai, just as all other false Dragons were. He has been dead since before the Trolloc Wars, two thousand years ago.

name: Red
chapter: Chapter 44: The Dark Along the Ways
info: Bay [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) borrows from [Basel Gill](#Basel-Gill). His hair is about the same color as Rand's own hair.

name: Rhea
info: Wife of [Caar](#Caar-al-Thorin-al-Toren), son of [Thorin](#Thorin-al-Toren-al-Ban), the king of Manetheren during the time [Mordeth](#Mordeth) was in power in Aridhol. She killed her husband, and after he was buried killed herself upon his grave.

name: Rogosh Eagle Eye
info: A nickname given to [Rogosh of Talmour](#Rogosh-of-Talmour).

name: Rogosh of Talmour
info: Hero of Legend, a man famed at the court of the High King, [Artur Paendrag Tanreall](#Artur-Hawkwing), feared on the slopes of Shayol Ghul. He was the greatest of all the Hunters for the Horn.

name: Rowan Hurn
info: Member of the Village Council of Emond's Field.

name: Rulan Allwine
info: Innkeeper of the inn in Market Sheran, where [Paitr Conel](#Paitr-Conel) meets [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon).

name: Salya
info: Daughter of [Lenn](#Lenn) in another of [Thom Merrilin](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin)'s gleeman tales. She walked among the stars in the story, which precedes the Age of Legends.

name: Samel Crawe
info: Member of the Village Council of Emond's Field.

name: Saml Hake
info: Innkeeper of The Dancing Cartman in Four Kings. He is the first skinny innkeeper [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) had ever met, and the only one he did not trust.

name: Sara
info: Cook in the Stag and Lion in Baerlon. She threatened to quit when [Master Fitch](#Master-Fitch) relayed people's complaints about the rats her cat was apparently leaving all over the inn; in reality these rats had their backs broken by [Ba'alzamon](#Ba-alzamon).

name: Scratch
info: Yellow cat native to the Winespring Inn in Emond's Field. Her usual perch is next to the fire or on top of the bookcase.

name: Semirhage
info: Semirhage is one of the Forsaken, the thirteen powerful Aes Sedai who dedicated their lives to serving the Shadow during the War of the Shadow. Her name is still used to frighten children into behaving as they should. In her case, the threat is that she will come and get the child if he or she keeps lying.

name: Shadowman
info: Boogeyman of the _Wheel of Time_.

name: Shai'tan
info: Source of all evil, antithesis of the [Creator](#Creator). He was imprisoned by the Creator at the moment of Creation at Shayol Ghul. This prison was bored into during the Age of Legends, which led to the War of the Shadow, the Time of Madness, the Breaking of the World, and the end of the Age of Legends. Since naming him by his true name brings ill fortune or disaster, many euphemisms exist, including Father of Lies, Grassburner, Heartsbane, Heartfang, Leafblighter, Lord of the Grave, Shepherd of the Night, Sightblinder, and Soulsbane. He is most commonly referred to as simply “The Dark One.”

name: Shepherd of the Night
info: Alternative name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Sheriam Bayanar
chapter: Chapter 44: The Dark Along the Ways
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) tells [Master Gill](#Basel-Gill) to contact her in Tar Valon if he got into any trouble for helping her.

name: Sightblinder
info: Aiel name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Sightburner
info: Aiel name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Strom
info: Bouncers at The Dancing Cartman. His arms are big enough to be legs.

name: Susa
info: Character who tamed [Jain Farstrider](#Jain-Farstrider) in one of [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin)'s stories.

name: Tad Barran
info: Stablehand at the Winespring Inn in Emond's Field.

name: Tamlin (Tam) al'Thor
info: [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s father, a shepherd in the Two Rivers. He has a thick, broad chest and a broad face, gray hair with black streaks in it. His cheeks have been roughened by the sun. He is a solid man. Keeping his word is important to him. When Tam was young, he left the Two Rivers to see the outside world, something which is extremely rare in the Two Rivers. While there he acquired a sword, and married [Kari](#Kari-al-Thor), a woman from Caemlyn. Since Kari's death fifteen years ago, Tam has raised Rand himself. Since Tam has been alone and without a wife for so long, many women in Emond's Field have been trying to find a match for him recently. They've also started to think about who would be good for his son as well.

name: Tamyrlin
info: Title [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) wore the ring of. It is likely this position was the predecessor of the modern [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat).

name: Taringail Damodred
info: [Tigraine](#Tigraine-Mantear)'s husband, a prince of Cairhien, half-brother of [King Laman](#Laman-Damodred). When Tigraine disappeared, he married [Morgase Trakand](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand), who had the best claim to the throne. He brought Cairhien into to the plotting surrounding the Succession. He had one child by Tigraine and two by Morgase: [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred), [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand), and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand). He did not really love either of his wives, his only goal being to see his son sit on the throne of Cairhien and his daughter sit on the throne of Andor.

name: Tarwin
info: Hero of old and subject of many songs and tales. He has a pass, Tarwin's Gap, named after him between Shienar and what was once Malkier.

name: The Dragon
info: Name given to [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) during the War of the Shadow. He did not like the name. The name is now associated with evil, since Lews Therin killed his entire family in his madness at the end of his life. It is said the Dragon will be Reborn at mankind's greatest hour of need to save the world—and Break it again.

name: Thomdril (Thom) Merrilin
info: Gleeman who comes to Emond's Field on Winternight. He seems to have a distrust of Aes Sedai and their ways. He has white hair and mustaches, and wears a patched cloak. He was once a Court-bard. Fond of elaborate bows and flourishes.

name: Thorin al Toren al Ban
info: Father of [Caar](#Caar-al-Thorin-al-Toren), grandfather of [Aemon](#Aemon-al-Caar-al-Thorin).

name: Tiam of Gazar
chapter: Chapter 50: Meetings at the EyeChapter 51: Against the ShadowChapter 52: There Is Neither Beginning Nor EndChapter 53: The Wheel TurnsGlossary
info: Person who proposed the Gazaran Calendar, which celebrated the alleged freedom from the Trolloc threat by recording Free Years (FY). This calendar was adopted due to the chaos the resulted during the Trolloc Wars and the resulting confusion as to which year it actually was under the Toman Calendar.

name: Tigraine Mantear
info: Daughter-Heir of Andor before [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) became queen, sister of [Luc Mantear](#Luc-Mantear). She disappeared before her mother died, and when she did there was no daughter-heir to take the throne, and the Succession began. There are some who believe she is still alive.

name: Toma dur Ahmid
chapter: Chapter 50: Meetings at the EyeChapter 51: Against the ShadowChapter 52: There Is Neither Beginning Nor EndChapter 53: The Wheel TurnsGlossary
info: Person who devised the Toman Calendar, which was adopted approximately two hundred years after the death of the last male Aes Sedai and continued until the Trolloc Wars. The Calendar recorded years After the Breaking, or AB.

name: Treebrother
info: What [Loial](#Loial) calls the [Green Man](#Green-Man).

name: Uren din Jubai Soaring Gull
chapter: Chapter 50: Meetings at the EyeChapter 51: Against the ShadowChapter 52: There Is Neither Beginning Nor EndChapter 53: The Wheel TurnsGlossary
info: Sea Folk scholar and deviser of the [Farede](#Farede) Calendar, which measured dates from the arbitrarily set end of the War of the Hundred Years as years of the New Era (NE). This calendar is currently in use.

name: Widow Aynal
info: Widow Aynal is a woman for which Widow Aynal's Meadow is named. No one remembers which Aynal widow it was actually named for; the meadow has been called that as long as anyone can remember.

name: Wil al'Caar
info: Son of [Paet](#Paet-al-Caar) from Emond's Field. He broke his leg during the Trolloc attack, and was Healed by [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred).

name: Wil al'Seen
info: Wil al'Seen is a young man from a farm between Deven Ride and Emond's Field. He is a year older than [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara). [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) thinks his ears look funny, but many of the other girls in the village think Wil is quite pretty. As a teen, he always had girls staring at him and whispering behind his back. He courted every girl, and managed to convince all of them that he was just being polite to the others.

name: Willim of Manaches
info: Author of a book in [Basel Gill](#Basel-Gill)'s library, _The Essays of Willim of Manaches_.

name: Wind
chapter: Chapter 21: Listen to the WindChapter 22: A Path ChosenChapter 23: Wolfbrother
info: Wolf that [Elyas](#Elyas-Machera) knows.

name: Wit Congar
info: Man from Emond's Field. He and his family are renowned troublemakers and complainers. He is scrawny, unlike his quite solid wife, [Daise](#Daise-Congar).

name: Yurian Stonebow
info: False [Dragon](#The-Dragon) of old times. [Ba'alzamon](#Ba-alzamon) claims that he was used by Aes Sedai, just as all other false Dragons were.

name: al'Akir Mandragoran
chapter: Chapter 47: More Tales of the Wheel
info: Last crowned king of Malkier, [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran)'s father. He died, with his country, the day the Trollocs attacked Malkier.

name: al'Lan Mandragoran
info: Guest in Emond's Field the day before Bel Tine. He is quite tall, has long hair that is graying at the temples and is held from his face by a narrow leather headband. His face is all stony planes and angles, weathered but unlined. He is [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred)'s Warder.

name: el'Leanna ti Mandragoran
chapter: Chapter 47: More Tales of the Wheel
info: Queen of Malkier before it was overrun. She was [Akir](#al-Akir-Mandragoran)'s wife, and [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran)'s father. She died, with her husband and country, the day the Trollocs overran Malkier.
